column1: Accept payments by credit cards with Lyra Collect.
column2: Accept payments by credit cards with Lyra Collect.

column1: Click this button to reset the module settings.
column2: Click this button to reset the module settings.

column1: The identifier provided by Lyra Collect.
column2: The identifier provided by Lyra Collect.

column1: Key provided by Lyra Collect for test mode (available in Lyra Expert Back Office).
column2: Key provided by Lyra Collect for test mode (available in Lyra Expert Back Office).

column1: Key provided by Lyra Collect (available in Lyra Expert Back Office after enabling production mode).
column2: Key provided by Lyra Collect (available in Lyra Expert Back Office after enabling production mode).

column1: The context mode of this module.
column2: The context mode of this module.

column1:
Algorithm used to compute the payment form signature. Selected algorithm must be the same as one configured in the Lyra Expert Back Office.
The HMAC-SHA-256 algorithm should not be activated if it is not yet available in the Lyra Expert Back Office, the feature will be available soon.
column2:
Algorithm used to compute the payment form signature. Selected algorithm must be the same as one configured in the Lyra Expert Back Office.
The HMAC-SHA-256 algorithm should not be activated if it is not yet available in the Lyra Expert Back Office, the feature will be available soon.

column1:
URL to copy into your Lyra Expert Back Office > Settings > Notification rules.
In multistore mode, notification URL is the same for all the stores.
column2:
URL to copy into your Lyra Expert Back Office > Settings > Notification rules.
In multistore mode, notification URL is the same for all the stores.

column1: Default language on the payment page.
column2: Default language on the payment page.

column1: Languages available on the payment page. If you do not select any, all the supported languages will be available.
column2: Languages available on the payment page. If you do not select any, all the supported languages will be available.

column1: The number of days before the bank capture (adjustable in your Lyra Expert Back Office).
column2: The number of days before the bank capture (adjustable in your Lyra Expert Back Office).

column1: If manual is selected, you will have to confirm payments manually in your Lyra Expert Back Office.
column2: If manual is selected, you will have to confirm payments manually in your Lyra Expert Back Office.

column1: The card type(s) that can be used for the payment. Select none to use gateway configuration.
column2: The card type(s) that can be used for the payment. Select none to use gateway configuration.

column1: Use the same category for all products.
column2: Use the same category for all products.

column1:
Match each product category with a Lyra Collect category.
Entries marked with * are newly added and must be configured.
column2:
Match each product category with a Lyra Collect category.
Entries marked with * are newly added and must be configured.

column1: The theme configuration to customize the payment page.
column2: The theme configuration to customize the payment page.

column1: Shop name to display on the payment page. Leave blank to use gateway configuration.
column2: Shop name to display on the payment page. Leave blank to use gateway configuration.

column1: Shop URL to display on the payment page. Leave blank to use gateway configuration.
column2: Shop URL to display on the payment page. Leave blank to use gateway configuration.

column1: Amount below which 3DS will be disabled. Needs subscription to selective 3DS option. For more information, refer to the module documentation.
column2: Amount below which 3DS will be disabled. Needs subscription to selective 3DS option. For more information, refer to the module documentation.

column1: If enabled, the buyer is automatically redirected to your site at the end of the payment.
column2: If enabled, the buyer is automatically redirected to your site at the end of the payment.

column1: Time in seconds (0-300) before the buyer is automatically redirected to your website after a successful payment.
column2: Time in seconds (0-300) before the buyer is automatically redirected to your website after a successful payment.

column1: Message displayed on the payment page prior to redirection after a successful payment.
column2: Message displayed on the payment page prior to redirection after a successful payment.

column1: Time in seconds (0-300) before the buyer is automatically redirected to your website after a declined payment.
column2: Time in seconds (0-300) before the buyer is automatically redirected to your website after a declined payment.

column1: Message displayed on the payment page prior to redirection after a declined payment.
column2: Message displayed on the payment page prior to redirection after a declined payment.

column1: Method that will be used for transmitting the payment result from the payment page to your shop.
column2: Method that will be used for transmitting the payment result from the payment page to your shop.

column1: Status of orders when payment is successfull.
column2: Status of orders when payment is successfull.

column1: Automatically create invoice when payment is successfull.
column2: Automatically create invoice when payment is successfull.

column1: If you disable this option, the shopping cart details will not be sent to the gateway. Attention, in some cases, this option has to be enabled. For more information, refer to the module documentation.
column2: If you disable this option, the shopping cart details will not be sent to the gateway. Attention, in some cases, this option has to be enabled. For more information, refer to the module documentation.

column1: Select « Yes » if you have a FacilyPay Oney contract.
column2: Select « Yes » if you have a FacilyPay Oney contract.

column1:
Define the FacilyPay Oney information about all shipping methods.
FacilyPay Oney label: The label of the shipping method (use 55 alphanumeric characters, accentuated characters and these special characters: space, slash, hyphen, apostrophe).
Type: The delivery type of shipping method.
Speed: Select whether the delivery is STANDARD or EXPRESS.
Entries marked with * are newly added and must be configured.
column2:
Define the FacilyPay Oney information about all shipping methods.
FacilyPay Oney label: The label of the shipping method (use 55 alphanumeric characters, accentuated characters and these special characters: space, slash, hyphen, apostrophe).
Type: The delivery type of shipping method.
Speed: Select whether the delivery is STANDARD or EXPRESS.
Entries marked with * are newly added and must be configured.

column1: Method title to display on payment means page.
column2: Method title to display on payment means page.

column1: Buyer's billing countries in which this payment method is available.
column2: Buyer's billing countries in which this payment method is available.

column1: Allowed file types: jpeg, gif, png.
column2: Allowed file types: jpeg, gif, png.

column1: Define amount restriction for each customer group.
column2: Define amount restriction for each customer group.

column1: The number of days before the bank capture. Enter value only if different from Lyra Collect general configuration.
column2: The number of days before the bank capture. Enter value only if different from Lyra Collect general configuration.

column1: Select how the credit card infos will be entered. Attention, to use data acquisition on the merchant site, you must ensure that you have subscribed to this option with Lyra Collect.

column2: Card type selection on merchant site

column1: Payment page integrated to checkout process (iframe mode)
column2: Payment page integrated to checkout process (iframe mode)

column1: The payment by token allows to pay orders without re-entering bank data at each payment. The Payment by token option should be enabled on your Lyra Collect store to use this feature.
column2: The payment by token allows to pay orders without re-entering bank data at each payment. The Payment by token option should be enabled on your Lyra Collect store to use this feature.

column1: REST API keys are available in your Lyra Expert Back Office (menu: Settings > Shops > REST API keys).
column2: REST API keys are available in your Lyra Expert Back Office (menu: Settings > Shops > REST API keys).

column1: Select a theme to use to display embedded payment fields. For more customization, you may edit module template manually.
column2: Select a theme to use to display embedded payment fields. For more customization, you may edit module template manually.

column1: Texts to use as placeholders for embedded payment fields.
column2: Texts to use as placeholders for embedded payment fields.

column1: Maximum number of payment retries after a failed payment (between 0 and 10). Leave blank to use gateway configuration.
column2: Maximum number of payment retries after a failed payment (between 0 and 10). Leave blank to use gateway configuration.

column1:
ATTENTION: The payment in installments feature activation is subject to the prior agreement of Société Générale.
If you enable this feature while you have not the associated option, an error 10000 – INSTALLMENTS_NOT_ALLOWED or 07 - PAYMENT_CONFIG will occur and the buyer will not be able to pay.
column2:
ATTENTION: The payment in installments feature activation is subject to the prior agreement of Société Générale.
If you enable this feature while you have not the associated option, an error 10000 – INSTALLMENTS_NOT_ALLOWED or 07 - PAYMENT_CONFIG will occur and the buyer will not be able to pay.

column1:
Click on « Add » button to configure one or more payment options.
Label: The option label to display on the frontend.
Min. amount: Minimum amount to enable the payment option.
Max. amount: Maximum amount to enable the payment option.
Contract: ID of the contract to use with the option.
Count: Total number of payments.
Period: Delay (in days) between payments.
1st payment: Amount of first payment, in percentage of total amount. If empty, all payments will have the same amount.
column2:
Click on « Add » button to configure one or more payment options.
Label: The option label to display on the frontend.
Min. amount: Minimum amount to enable the payment option.
Max. amount: Maximum amount to enable the payment option.
Contract: ID of the contract to use with the option.
Count: Total number of payments.
Period: Delay (in days) between payments.
1st payment: Amount of first payment, in percentage of total amount. If empty, all payments will have the same amount.

column1: Select the gift card types that can be used for the payment.
column2: Select the gift card types that can be used for the payment.

column1:
Click on button to add one or more new gift cards.
Card code: The Lyra Collect exact gift card code.
Card label: The label of the new gift card.
Card logo: The gift card logo to display on payment method selection page.
column2:
Click on button to add one or more new gift cards.
Card code: The Lyra Collect exact gift card code.
Card label: The label of the new gift card.

column1: The number of days before the bank capture. Enter value only if different from Lyra Collect general configuration. This setting is considered only if the buyer uses another CC to complete the payment.
column2: The number of days before the bank capture. Enter value only if different from Lyra Collect general configuration. This setting is considered only if the buyer uses another CC to complete the payment.

column1: If manual is selected, you will have to confirm payments manually in your Lyra Expert Back Office. This setting is considered only if the buyer uses another CC to complete the payment.

column1:
Click on Add button to configure one or more payment options.
Label: The option label to display on the frontend (the %c, %r and %a patterns will be respectively replaced by payments count, option rate and option amount).
Code: The option code as defined in your FacilyPay Oney contract.
Min. amount: Minimum amount to enable the payment option.
Max. amount: Maximum amount to enable the payment option.
Count: Total number of payments.
Rate: The interest rate in percentage.
column2:

Max. amount: Maximum amount to enable the payment option.
Count: Total number of payments.
Rate: The interest rate in percentage.
